definition: to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge

sentences.english: The rain drummed loudly on the metal roof.
sentences.chinese: 雨點敲擊金屬屋頂，發出很大的聲響。

sentences.english: Q. So beware the tapping of the pen.
sentences.chinese: 因此要留意那支鋼筆的敲擊。

sentences.english: They knock each other off balance just a little bit.
sentences.chinese: 她說，“他們只是一點點敲擊彼此的不平衡之處。”

sentences.english: With a final beat, and Pedrito's cave burst with hot light.
sentences.chinese: 隨着最後一下敲擊聲，強光突然射入帕吉特呆的洞穴。

sentences.english: He didn’t get off his stool and bang it on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他並沒有離開高腳凳並用其敲擊地面。

sentences.english: Then he took out his tinderbox and struck the flint.
sentences.chinese: 於是他拿出火絨箱，並敲擊打火石。

sentences.english: Slide and tap in reservoir retainer clips until tab locks to housing.
sentences.chinese: 滑動並敲擊貯油槽扣件夾，直至凸耳鎖緊外殼。

sentences.english: A sound made by tapping on the hull of a ship will be reflected from the sea bottom.
sentences.chinese: 通過敲擊空船發出的聲音將會從海底反射回來。

sentences.english: An infrared camera could record which keys you pressed.
sentences.chinese: 紅外攝像頭可以記錄下你所敲擊的按鍵。

sentences.english: The primitive dance also has the metre which raps or sings toaccompany with.
sentences.chinese: 原始的舞蹈也有敲擊出來的節拍或歌唱相伴和。

sentences.english: The monitor rapped the meeting to order.
sentences.chinese: 班長啪啪敲擊宣佈開會。

sentences.english: Flat clappers made of bone or wood originally used by the end man in a minstrel show.
sentences.chinese: 打拍者巡遊演出中站在一端敲擊骨制或木製響板的人。

sentences.english: He drummed the desk with his fingers.
sentences.chinese: 他用手指答答地敲擊書桌。

sentences.english: In some games, he whacks at a keyboard.
How are you supposed to hold the thing, especially while tapping the on-screen keypad?
sentences.chinese: 當你敲擊屏幕上的鍵盤時該怎樣拿着它？

sentences.english: The chairman rapped on the table for order.
sentences.chinese: 主席敲擊桌子以維持秩序。

definition: hammer/to hammer into shape/weight (e.g. of a steelyard or balance)/to strike with a hammer
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
car window/window of vehicle (bus, train etc)
to stir/to prod/to poke/to move sideways/to strum (on a guitar etc)
to eject/to exit from/to pop up
to cut open/to rip/to streak across (lightning, meteor etc)/to pierce (scream, searchlight etc)
to roll/(to do sth) in a loop/to scroll (computing)/to progressively expand (economics)/to rumble (of thunder)
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
